alert.note: Alert for Cibola; Socorro; Valencia (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 5:53PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Socorro and Valencia. In west central New Mexico, Cibola. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Socorro, Belen, Magdalena, San Acacia, La Joya, Lemitar, Veguita, Escondida, Jarales, Chamizal, Abeytas, Sabinal and Las Nutrias. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 110 and 128...and between Mile Markers 136 and 138. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 146 and 172...and between Mile Markers 178 and 187. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
